comments.body: Have you (or anyone else) tested what happens when `ownca_not_after` lies in the past? Does OpenSSL complain, or just signs the certificate? I'm wondering because if it complains / dies / ..., this test will start failing in a year. :)

@felixfontein good point! I just went ahead and tested it, the certificate is created without problems when choosing a validity period in the past. It even succeeds when notAfter lies before notBefore.
Awesome! That's what I was hoping for! :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +121,125 @@    provider: ownca
    ownca_not_before: 20181023133742Z
    ownca_not_after: 20191023133742Z
    path: "{{ output_dir }}/ownca_cert3.pem"
    csr_path: "{{ output_dir }}/csr.csr"
